column5: https://worldview.earthdata.nasa.gov...T18%3A31%3A46Z my resort owner gave me this link to view real time conditions....but I can't get good enough resolution to learn anything....may stay starts on the 24th This is for Eagle Lake....the big one...., but I assume it can be moved to other areas....maybe it won't work at all

The tradeoff seems to be timeliness or resolution - I haven't been able to achieve both. Sentinel 2 imagery is nice res, but typically a few days out of date. The picture shows Eagle Lake/VB 2 days ago - maybe some open water around the edges, but a ways to go. This image was downloaded from the Sentinel Hub EO Browser:
My contact in Red Lake thinks late next week its gone. May 13, 14.
Today's ice in red lake. Based on forecast, ice will be out very shortly
Here is an excellent site for Lake of the Woods. Updates are almost daily, and lots of pics, satelite images, etc.https://icepatrol.wordpress.com/
Sorry Tonyo....didn't see that you posted it already!
Can someone please tell me about a site where I can check to see if a lac is still covered in ice or open?
I would call it a lake but defer to what Canadians address them as.
In most of Canada it is a lake, in Quebec it is lac. Just for clarification.
My lac is still covered with ice.
Looking at next week’s forecast for Dryden d it’s showing highs of 22/23c which will really help. My bet is in 2 weeks it will all be gone.

I hope to be on open water in about a week. Satellite imagery is starting to show some holes in some areas already. The thing is, water is at it's greatest density at 39F, so there's actually a lot of "warm" water under that ice. As soon as a little wind stirs up the water at the holes, its gone!
